sentences.en: Already some people are asking whether scientists have any right to meddle in such matters.
sentences.cn: 已经有人在问科学家是否有权干预这类事情。

sentences.en: But then Noble Talent and Lustrous Jade had begun to meddle.
sentences.cn: 但是后来玮才和莹琨又开始惹事生非.

sentences.en: Do not meddle in things that do not concern you.
sentences.cn: 别参与和自己无关的事.

sentences.en: Don't meddle in the internal affairs of other countries.
Falsehood like a nettle stings those who meddle with it.
sentences.cn: 谎言似荨麻,玩弄会刺手.

sentences.en: He accused the US of meddling in China’s internal affairs .
sentences.cn: 他指责美国干涉中国内政。

sentences.en: He did not meddle with the dean and chapter.
sentences.cn: 他并不去干扰教长和牧师会.

sentences.en: He had no right to meddle in her affairs.
He is inclined to meddle in other people's affairs.
sentences.cn: 他总喜欢干涉别人的事.

sentences.en: I will teach him not to meddle in my affairs.
sentences.cn: 我要教训他一下不要干涉我的事情.

sentences.en: I will teach you to meddle in my affairs.
sentences.cn: 你再管我的事我就要教训你了.

sentences.en: The bear was walking softly on, and offered to meddle with nobody.
sentences.cn: 那只熊正慢条斯理地向前走, 看起来并不想管别人的闲事.

sentences.en: They're resentful that outsiders presume to meddle in their affairs.
sentences.cn: 他们对外人擅自干预他们的事务非常愤慨。

sentences.en: You'd better not meddle with married women, it always leads to trouble.
sentences.cn: 你最好别妨碍已婚女子(的生活), 那总是要引起麻烦的.

trans.tran_cn: 干涉，管闲事，干预他人之事，瞎搞，乱弄
trans.tran_en: to deliberately try to influence or change a situation that does not concern you, or that you do not understand
